page.title: 13Farming - Denny & Dunipace
page.content: Denny and Dunipace lie just outside the vast{Carse of Stirling,}one of the most productive areas in Scotland. Our land is made up from shale, sandstone and coal. It is watered by the Carron. Fields are divided by{dry-stane dykes and{hawthorn hedges}and there are a few modern fences. Until a century ago, our area was very agricultural and{Grand Ploughing Contests}were big social events. Today most of the fields are used for grazing both dairy and beef cattle. More grass than hay is grown and kept for silage. Other crops found are barley, a little wheat and a few potatoes. We saw one field of oil_seed rape. This is the first year it has grown here, due to{E.E.C. {subsidy.}The E.E.C. wants farm workers to earn as much as others and encourages farmers to improve land, equipment and buildings.
